Class TabConverter

public class TabConverter
extends java.lang.Object

Used to convert the TAB text in to the internal code and vise versa.

Method Detail

revert

public static java.lang.String revert(byte[] b)
This method does the reverse process of the method convert.

Parameters:
b - sequence of numbers for which the equivalent string is required.

convert

public static byte[] convert(java.lang.String p)
Converts the given text to the internal code. Gets a string and checks each character. According to this it will check the next first and second characters if necessary. With this check condition appropriate one or two integers will be added in the output byte[]. If a character is non-Tamil character then a zero (‘0’) will be added stating that non Tamil is started and it puts the non-Tamil character’s equivalent ASCII value. If the non-Tamil characters end by a Tamil character it will put a zero (‘0’) stating that non-Tamil ends and then puts the correct numbers in the output bye[]. Ex. Some words and their converted out puts are given bellow. Üñ¢ñ£ - 1 23 23 2 Üabcñ¢ñ£ - 1 0 97 98 99 0 23 23 2 Apple - 0 65 112 112 108 101

Parameters:
p - string to be converted.

checkLa

public static boolean checkLa(char nexttola)
Used to check the 'La' character(29) comes as a combination three letters or separate letter.

Parameters:
nexttola - next character of 'la' in the text.
Returns:
boolean true if 'La' comes in three letter consonant i.e 'auv' false if 'La' comes in two letters consonant

checkLanguage

public static boolean checkLanguage(java.lang.String word)
Used to check whether the given word is Tamil word or non-Tamil word. It checks the first character. If this is Tamil then the word is Tamil word. Otherwise it is a non-Tamil word. Mixed words are not considered here. That is they are decided with their first character.

Parameters:
word - word whose language has to be identified.
Returns:
boolean true if the word is tamil, otherwise false.
